p: Eczema and a family history of asthma are the dominant non-infectious risk factors for pediatric asthma, while the triggers of adult-onset disease are less well defined. The causes for asthma exacerbation have been described and categorized. Of note, clinicians should recognize the seasonal trends for exacerbations of wheezing or asthma in adults, which occur 1â€“2 weeks later than in children, suggesting household transmission of the same strain ( Johnston et al., 1996). HRV can be documented throughout the year, with a predilection for late spring and fall ( Nagel et al., 2008), whereas RSV can be detected in late autumn to winter ( Figure 1 ).
